title: Gas recovery.
abstract: CO2 is separated from a gas mixture containing medium boiling point gases, such as nitrogen, carbon monoxide, methane, and/or argon, and optionally also hydrogen by a pressure swing adsorption (PSA) process operated at above 50 DEG C. The PSA cycle preferably employs two or more depressurisation stages: the final stage, which is preferably counter-current, gives higher purity CO2 than the previous depressurisation stage or stages which are preferably co-current.

motivations: There is a need to separate CO2 from gas mixtures containing medium boiling point gases.
objectives: Separate CO2 from gas mixtures using a pressure swing adsorption (PSA) process.
methods: Operate the PSA process at above 50 DEG C.
Employ two or more depressurisation stages in the PSA cycle.
Use a counter-current final stage to achieve higher purity CO2.
results: Achieve higher purity CO2 from gas mixtures.
llama_json.research_subject: CO2 separation from gas mixtures using pressure swing adsorption

motivations: There is a need for efficient methods to separate CO2 from gas mixtures containing medium boiling point gases.
objectives: To separate CO2 from a gas mixture using a pressure swing adsorption (PSA) process operated at above 50 DEG C.
methods: Use a PSA process with two or more depressurisation stages to separate CO2 from the gas mixture.
The final stage of the PSA process is counter-current to achieve higher purity CO2.
results: Achieve higher purity CO2 from gas mixtures containing medium boiling point gases.
openai_json.research_subject: Gas recovery through pressure swing adsorption process

motivations: There is a need for efficient separation of CO2 from gas mixtures containing medium boiling point gases for industrial applications.
objectives: Develop a pressure swing adsorption process to effectively separate CO2 from gas mixtures containing nitrogen, carbon monoxide, methane, argon, and optionally hydrogen.
methods: Employ a pressure swing adsorption (PSA) process operated at temperatures above 50°C.
Implement a PSA cycle with two or more depressurization stages, using counter-current flow in the final stage and co-current flow in previous stages.
results: Achieve higher purity CO2 separation through the optimized multi-stage depressurization approach.
anthropic_json.research_subject: CO2 separation from gas mixtures using pressure swing adsorption
